intro: Randia spicata, commonly known as the spiked randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered white or pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Randia spicata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
